intro: Austroeupatorium apense, commonly known as Eastern boneset, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture.
